my:Details.my:Title: Cargo Crane Un-parking/Parking and Cargo Crane Operation

my:Hazard.my:Description: Awareness - Struck by cargo crane gear
Equipment failure i.e. crane wires, hooks, lifting accessories

my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Maintenance and inspection of vessel's lighting i.e. cargo hold, crane, deck, etc, to be carried out in accordance with Company MPM system; b) Use portable lighting if required.

a) Crane operations should be postponed during strong winds; b) If the visibility of the crane operator is restricted due to heavy precipitation, crane operations should be postponed until the weather improves.

a) Crew vigilance - The OOW should ensure there is sufficient clearance between the vessel and any shore gear at all times; b) Communication and an agreement must be established between the OOW, crane operator and foreman / terminal operator if shore gear has to be re-positioned - The vessel's crane must ensure there is sufficient clearance during the re-positioning.

my:Main.my:Footer: Risk Assessment: D 09 - Cargo Crane Un-parking/Parking and Cargo Crane Operation
